intro: Phyllonoma triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered phyllonoma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Phyllonoma triflora is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological niche.
